result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald R Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (05/18/2018)

1:07 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Quinn Cavanaugh present in court via telephone.  FTP $543.00.  Statement by defendant - hopes to have paid within in a couple of months.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends the defendant's probation for 1 year.  Court instructs defendant that if not paid by the next discharge date the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.

Notice of Hearing sent to Agent Quinn Cavanaugh for probation review hearing scheduled on 04/17/2017 at 1:00 p.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  No such street.  Unable to Forward.  Re-sent to:  Department of Corrections 2000 American Blvd Suite B  Neenah, WI  54115

JOC has been returned.  Inmate Not Here.  -6192015 - Re-sent to:  187 S. Wisconsin St  Berlin, WI  54923

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

3:39 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, will plea to count 2 with probation and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty as domestic and repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 as charged.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months 

CONDITIONS:

30 days county jail - 60 days to report with huber and will allow out of county service
AODA and any follow-up
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription
Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up
court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
